CatDescriptText: Cornella Blair, waitress, Webster Avenue and James McKinnon, truck driver, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that labor unions, in general, are doing all they can to see that Negroes are not discriminated against in hiring and upgrading in employment?"  Mrs. Blair's answer reads: "Yes, if they are qualified."  Mr. McKinnon's answer reads: "No, I don't"
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Cornella Blair wearing light colored beret and large floral earring, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of James McKinnon wearing dark pea coat, and cap, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
